MINISTRY OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING NATIONAL ECONOMICS UNIVERSITY | SOCIALIST REPUBLIC OF VIETNAM Independence – Freedom – Happiness
COURSE SYLLABUS (Issued attached Decision of NEU’s President,           ,            , 2023) | COURSE SYLLABUS (Issued attached Decision of NEU’s President,           ,            , 2023)
Bachelor of Software Engineering | Bachelor of Software Engineering

* Title: Software Testing and Quality Assurance
* Code: CNTT1178
* Credits: 3 (45)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs
+ Exercises in class: 10 hrs
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs
+ Self-study: 60 hrs
* Parallel course(s):
* Prerequisite course(s): CNTT1131, CNTT1116
* Department conducting the course:
+ Faculty: Information Technology; Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334)
+ Lecturers:
1. PhD. Lê Thị Hoài Thu 	Tel: 0912727529	Email: thulh@neu.edu.vn
2. MSc. Trần Thị Mỹ Diệp	Tel: 0904335056	Email: diepttm@neu.edu.vn
* Kind of the course:

Foundation □ | Foundation □ | Fundamental (x) | Fundamental (x)
Compulsory □ | Elective □ | Compulsory | Elective (x)
* Course language: 	In English
* Meeting hours: 8 AM – 11 AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University

The course aims to provide students with knowledge of software testing, software, testing procedures and basic techniques in test design and installation testing, and help students develop the ability to design tests and evaluate the effectiveness of testing a specific software in practice. In addition, the course also provides understanding and how to use some of the error management tools, and automation testing tools.
Course content includes:
- Overview of software testing
- Testing in the software development process
- Test plan
- Design test case
- Methods and techniques testing
- Executing test by using tools
- Log bugs
The course also aims to train thinking skills, the ability to self-study knowledge, and technology to develop mobile applications by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to learn deeply about technologies, from which they can present in their solutions using new technologies to develop mobile applications.

* Textbooks/Lecture Notes:
- Glenford J Myer et.al, (2012), The Art of Software Testing, 3rd, John Wiley & Sons, Inc.
- Paul Ammann & Jeff Offutt, (2008), Introduction to Software Testing, Cambridge Press.
- [Phạm Ngọc Hùng, Trương Anh Hoàng và Đặng Văn Hưng (2014). Giáo trình kiểm thử phần mềm, Đại học Quốc Gia
- Thạc Bình Cường (2011) Kiểm thử và đảm bảo chất lượng phần mềm, Nhà xuất bản Trường Đại Học Bách Khoa Hà Nội.
* Additional references:
[5] Dorothy Graham, (2015), Foundation of Software Testing: ISTQB Certification, Thomson
[6] Andreas Spillner, Tilo Linz, Hans Schaefer. Software Testing Foundations.  A Study Guide for the Certified Tester Exam. 4th Edition
[7] Kshirasagar Naik. Software testing and quality assurance theory and practice.

Table 4. Course goals
Goals | Goals Description | Proficiency scale
G1 | The course provides students with knowledge about testing software: testing procedures and plans, fundamental techniques in designing and installing test; automation test tools. In addition, the course provides intensive knowledge in testing to analyze and evaluate the quality of software. | 3-4
G2 | The course helps students develop communication, presentation, report writing, and time management skills. It provides practical training in professional skills necessary for software testing. | 3U
G3 | The course contributes to developing the ability to work independently and collaboratively, fostering a correct understanding of responsibilities in task execution and professional ethics. | 3

Table 5. Course learning outcomes (CLOs)
Goals | CLOs | CLOs Description | Teaching level (I,T,U)
G1 | CLO1.1 | Describe knowledge of software testing: role of software testing (in SDLC), testing process and plan, main techniques in designing and implementing tests; Automated testing, and tools for automation software testing. | I
G1 | CLO1.2 | Applying black box and white box testing methods. Distinguish different levels of testing including unit testing, integration testing, and system testing in illustrative examples. Applying different testing techniques to each level of testing. | U
G1 | CLO1.3 | Applying the testing process from test planning to closure testing activities. Able to write documents related to software testing such as test plans, exit criteria, and error reports (bug log). | U
G2 | CLO2.1 | Having the skills to search, gather, synthesize, analyze, and present information to solve problems related to software testing. | U
G2 | CLO2.2 | Have written communication skills, report writing, and in-depth presentations related to plans, strategies, and implementation of assigned tasks, and have communication skills in the online environment | U
G2 | CLO2.3 | Have skills in appropriately applying knowledge, methods, techniques, and testing tools to develop and evaluate software in a particular project. | U
G3 | CLO3.1 | Having the ability to self-study and research relevant to complete assigned tasks. | U
G3 | CLO3.2 | Able to organize team activities; execute and evaluate team members' task quality. | U
G3 | CLO3.3 | Understanding the responsibilities in task execution, and maintaining professional ethics in tasks related to software testing | U

Table 6. Assessment summary
Assessments | CLOs | Weighting (%) | Week
Formative assessment | Formative assessment | Formative assessment | Formative assessment
Participant: Learning attitude Answers questions Discussions | CLO1.x CLO2.x CLO3.x | 10% | -
Midterm assessment | Midterm assessment | Midterm assessment | Midterm assessment
Individual test (20%): Quiz (10 Questions) Practical Exercise (4 Exercises) | CLO1.x CLO2.x CLO3.x | 40% | 9
Group project (20%): Group production Group presentation | CLO1.x CLO2.x CLO3.x | 40% | 14
Summative assessment | Summative assessment | Summative assessment | Summative assessment
Final exam | CLO1.x CLO2.x CLO3.x | 50% | As scheduled

Table 7.1. Lesson plan for the course
Week | Content | Readings requirement | CLO | Teaching and Learning Activities | Assessment tools and criteria
[1] | [2] | [3] | [4] | [5] | [6]
1 | Introduce • Course outlines | Course Syllabus | CLO1.1 CLO 2. 1 | Introduction to course Announce classroom rules. | Participant Individual tests Group works
2-3 | Chapter 1. Overview of mobile programming • Basic concepts of software testing • The Role of software testing in SDLC • Category of testing method • Category of testing technique • Category of testing level • Design test: specification test and test case • Principles of testing • Testing process | [1] Chapter 1,2 [2] Part 1, 9 [3] Chapter 1 [4] Chapter 1,2 [5] Chapter 1,2 | CLO1.1 CLO1.2 CLO2.1 CLO3.2 | Lecturing Group discussion Individual testing | Participant Individual tests Group works
4-5-6 | Chapter 2. Software testing techniques • Black box testing • White box testing | [1] Chapter 4 [2] Part 2,3,5 [3] Chương5,6,7 [4] Chapter 4 | CLO 1.1 CLO 1.2 CLO 2.1 CLO 3.1 | Lecturing Group discussion Individual testing | Participant Individual tests Group works
7-8-9 | Chapter 3. Testing levels • Unit test • Integration test • System test • Acceptance test • Regression test | [1] Chapter5,6,7 [3] Chapter 10,11 [4] Chapter 5 | CLO1.x CLO 2.1 CLO 2.3 CLO 3.1 | Lecturing Group discussion Individual testing | Participant Individual tests Group works
10 | Middle Exam (20%) | - | CLO1.x CLO 2.x CLO 3.x | - | -
11 | Chapter 4. Software errors management • Concepts of software errors • Debugging • Manage software errors | [1] Chapter 8 [5] Chapter 5 | CLO1.x CLO 2.x CLO 3.x | Lecturing Group discussion Individual testing | Participant Individual tests Group works
12-13 | Chapter 5. Automation testing • Introduce automated testing • Automated testing process • Assessment advantages and disadvantages of automation test • Automation test tool | [1] Chapter 5 [3] Chapter 9 [5] Chapter 6 | CLO1.1 CLO1.2 CLO 2.x CLO 3.x | Lecturing Group discussion Individual testing | Participant Individual tests Group works
14-15 | Group Presentation | - | CLO1.x CLO1.x CLO3.x | Report and answer questions | Criteria evaluation form: (i) Content (ii) Form (iii) Presentation time (iv) Cooperation
- | Final exam | - | CLO1.x CLO2.x | Students take exams according to given schedule | Computer-based practical examination
- Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).

- Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
- Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
- Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.

- The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
- Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
- Laptops and tablets are only used to take notes for and calculate for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.

PhD Pham Xuan Lam | Prof. PhD Pham Hong Chuong

2. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS

4-5-6 | Chapter 2. Software testing techniques • Black box testing • White box testing | [1] Chapter 4 [2] Part 2,3,5 [3] Chương5,6,7 [4] Chapter 4 | CLO 1.1 CLO 1.2 CLO 2.1 CLO 3.1 | Lecturing Group discussion Individual testing | Participant Individual tests Group works

- | Final exam | - | CLO1.x CLO2.x | Students take exams according to given schedule | Computer-based practical examination
8. COURSE REQUIREMENT & EXPECTATION
8.1. Requirements for taking final /terminal exams
- Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
8.2. Requirements for attending classes
- Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
- Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
- Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
8.3. Requirements for in-class behavior
- The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behavior that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
- Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
- Laptops and tablets are only used to take notes for and calculate for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
Faculty Dean | NEU’s President
PhD Pham Xuan Lam | Prof. PhD Pham Hong Chuong
